dialogues.text: RUBEN BRANDT (45) is alone in the railcar, sitting by the window, reading a book. The monotonous clatter of the tra is lulling him to sleep. He gets up and heads to the toil through the empty hallway. The train goes into a tunnel. hallway is dark. He goes in to the bathroom. He washes hi hands while whistling. Suddenly, a little boy appears in the background. The boy wears breeches and a shirt, stands in the bathtub and sta Ruben in the face. Ruben wakes up in the railcar. Another boy (FRANK DUVENEC WHISTLING BOY, 8), holding a snail, is sitting in front o him, stares straight into his eyes while whistling. A window abruptly falls open and a strong gust of wind sl Ruben in the face. Ruben is horrified; a little girl (VELAZQUEZ'S INFANTA MARGARITA, 7), is hanging outside th railcar.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Hey! Her fingers can barely grasp the metal frame of the open window. She screams for help.

dialogues.speaker: INFANTA MARGARITA
dialogues.text: (shouts ) Help me! Help me! The moment Ruben leaps over and catches the girl by her t wrist she bites hard on Ruben's bare hand. Ruben screams with pain, trying to pull his hand out of t girl's mouth, but the girl is much stronger and she slowl pulls him out of the train. Ruben is struggling to no avail. He desperately turns his head towards the boy, seeking help. The boy watches indifferently and keeps whistling his tune. Only Ruben's feet remain in the railcar; but to his horro he notices the approaching lights of a locomotive on the opposite track. Ruben screams. 0020. INT./EXT. - RUBEN BRANDT’S ROOM. POLYART CLINIC.

dialogues.speaker: DORNBERK. SLOVENIA
dialogues.text: Ruben is breathing heavily as he wakes up on the couch u down, one foot stuck in the headboard. The wall above the holds framed honorary diplomas from renowned psychiatric conferences. He picks up a voice recorder.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: My nightmares are getting stronger and stronger. Characters from famous paintings continue to attack me. This time, it was Velazquez’s Infanta Margarita and Frank Duveneck’s Whistling Boy. I haven't had a good night’s sleep in three weeks now. (takes a deep breath) Meanwhile, in the hall of the Polyart Clinic, the NIGHT G (38) watches the news.

dialogues.speaker: WEATHER FORECAST
dialogues.text: «+. 20 degrees and highs near 27. Mostly sunny and dry for the weekend. Lowest relative humidity, 25 percent. BREAKING NEWS I. Breaking News! Approximately 30 minutes ago Paris Police announced that the priceless fan owned by Egyptian pharaoh Cleopatra was stolen from the Louvre Museum. Witnesses reported that a young woman in black broke the glass case containing the fan and then escaped by doing a back flip out of the window and speeding off in a red Mercedes in the direction of the Place de la Concorde.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: Two cars are chasing each other through the streets of Pa Behind the wheel of the first car is MIMI (28), the secon driven by MIKE KOWALSKI (40). Their cars drive in paralle close to each other. After taking a sharp turn, their car slightly bump into each other.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Bonjour, Madame!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mademoiselle... you didn’t come to Paris to steal that fan, did you?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Non, détective Kowalski. I just wanted to give you something to do. Mimi puts the car into gear and rushes away. Kowalski dri after her. The car chase continues. Their way is littered with damaged cars, busted up shop windows, scattered tabl frightened tourists. The cars almost hit a CONSIERGE(65), who is feeding a cat

dialogues.speaker: CONSIERGE
dialogues.text: Cicicicicici! At a restaurant, a couple, GEORGE (60) AND MARGARET (55) having a romantic dinner.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Oh, Margaret, this city is just so romantic!

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET
dialogues.text: Oh, George!

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I wish we could stay in Paris forever.

dialogues.speaker: MARGARET
dialogues.text: How about another bottle of wine?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: (In French) Garcon, s’il vous plait! (Waiter, please!) Mimi and Kowalski crash into the restaurant, but the coup doesn’t pay attention. The cars continue to chase each ot They enter a narrow street, where Mimi pushes Kowalski’s on the wall. Kowalski is struggling to keep the car in th right direction.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (in a sarcastic tone) Impressive! A YOUNG MOTHER (25) is crossing the road with a crying ba

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MOTHER
dialogues.text: (to the baby in the carriage) Bidibidibidi! They almost hit the mother with the baby in the carriage. A YOUNG MAN (19) stands beside a small truck with his ph in hand.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Mom, I’m old enough, I can take care of myself... Mimi's car almost hits him but in the last moment he is pushed away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVENING —- CONTINUOUS After a wild crash, they fall into a dance bar and contin their race on foot through the streets and rooftops of Pa Mimi nearly makes her escape with an elaborate somersault from one rooftop to another, but the chase continues unti they end up on a boat over the Seine, where Kowalski entr Mimi with an anchor rope. Mimi hangs upside down while Kowalski takes out a pair of handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Mademoiselle... you were sent to steal the Regent Diamond!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Not bad for a Frenchman.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: I'm not French.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (in French) Visiblement. (Obviously. )

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Why the fan?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Because beauty shouldn’t be locked away. Mimi whips out Cleopatra’s fan.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Some beauties must be locked away.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Well, then choose wisely, mon chéri! She spreads the fan open and all of a sudden tosses it in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no, no....! (beat) Don't! MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) Damn! Kowalski jumps over the railing straight into the river t save the fan.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Mimi is sitting in a hot air balloon. The idyllic landsca of the Slovenian countryside can be seen under her. She d a number.

dialogues.speaker: TIME
dialogues.text: A SECRETARY (35) at the Polyart Clinic answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Polyart Clinic. May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, this is Mimi. Could I speak to Dr. Brandt?

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Mimi who?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Just Mimi.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Ruben Brandt answers the call.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Hello? (beat) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I'll be straightforward, doctor. I have a problem that’s getting in the way of my work.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Narcolepsy? Tourette’s? ADHD?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Kleptomania.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Aha. So you're stealing from your employer.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Not quite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi stands in front of an advertisement poster for the Louvre museum - "THE FRENCH ROYAL TREASURY - THE REGENT DIAMOND" - it says. She smiles at the poster, like a cat would at the mouse i about to devour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi’s shadow follows her as she is climbing up the walls She enters the museum through a ventilation window. INT. - THE LOUVRE MUSEUM. PARIS. FRANCE - EVENING -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Mimi runs through the Department of Egyptian Antiquities, when something catches her eye - the Cleopatra fan. Mimi hesitates. She looks at the “ROYAL DIAMOND EXHIBITIO sign and the Cleopatra fan one more time. She breaks the glass vitrine, takes the fan and jumps out of the window a moment before the last security bar falls down. She jumps into a parked convertible car and drives away. Kowalski follows her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi is in the air balloon, on the phone with Ruben.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: So, hanging around wasn’t an option.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (In French) Absolument. (Absolutely. )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi packs her stuff in a hurry. Her phone rings. She fin it under the Psychology Journal with Ruben Brandt on the cover. She looks at her phone.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Oh, great. She answers the call, her voice turns sweet.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the phone) Hi, sweetie!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. — VINCENZO’S BOX CLUB. NEW YORK. THE UNITED STATES —

dialogues.speaker: VINCENZO DELANGELLO
dialogues.text: (angry) Cut the crap, huh! Where is my diamond?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Last time I checked, it was in the Louvre.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENZO DELANGELLO
dialogues.text: Well, the last time I checked I was paying you cash for it, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something came up.

dialogues.speaker: VINCENZO DELANGELLO
dialogues.text: A fan? (laughs ) Mimi, I would not want to be in your shoes right now. VINCENZO DELANGELLO (49) cuts the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: So, you see, I have to get better, and quick. I read in a magazine that you're the best shrink to treat artistic souls.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. —- THE POLYART CLINIC. DORNBERK. SLOVENIA - DAY - SA

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: I don’t know about the best.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn’t a very good magazine.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Thanks for the vote of confidence. Mimi receives a text message from “Vincenzo:” I will find you! Mimi sighs. RUBEN BRANDT (CONT’D) Hello? You there?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Yeah, Doc. I’ll see you soon. She throws the phone out of the balloon.

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: Idyllic landscape with a lake and tall mountains in the background. Mimi is seen in a car, driving towards the Polyart Clinic.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: A couple of people stand around a fire. Behind them, ther a folding screen with a romantic painted forest on it. Ru stands in front BYE-BYE JOE (30), MEMBRANO BRUNO (33) and FERNANDO (24). He begins an art therapy session.

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: -.. I don't wanna be Little Red Riding Hood!

dialogues.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogues.text: Come on! It’s only a therapy. Yesterday I was Little Red Riding Hood.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Thank you Fernando! (turns to Bye-Bye Joe) Bye-Bye Joe, you are here because you can’t keep quiet in delicate situations. Playing this role is exactly what you need.

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: (sighs ) Okay Doc. I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: So, Bye-Bye Joe, you will be Little Red Riding Hood. Membrano Bruno, you will be the thunder, the wind and the wolf. Fernando, you will be the bells, Granny and Luke, the hunter. Okay, now you know your roles, so let’s start! We can hear Little Red Riding Hood walking through the forest: squish - squish - squish!

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: Aha... Squish - squish - squish!

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Excellent. Places everyone - and let’s start! A dark and stormy night. A terrible wind roars. Ruben points at Membrano Bruno.  10.

dialogues.speaker: MEMBRANO BRUNO
dialogues.text: Hoo0o00000... hoooo0co...

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: The bells of the nearby church ring... He points at Fernando.

dialogues.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogues.text: Ding - dong!

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Little Red Riding Hood is walking through the forest... It’s Bye-Bye Joe’s turn.

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: Squish - squish - squish - squish!

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Somewhere in the distance, a wolf howls...

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: While in a cottage at the edge of the forest, Granny is asleep...

dialogues.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogues.text: HYrrrrrrr..... haaaaa....

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: The same forest is also home to Luke, the hunter...

dialogues.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogues.text: (yodels )

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Thunder rumbles powerfully nearby...

dialogues.speaker: MEMBRANO BRUNO
dialogues.text: (he vibrates noisily using his two-dimensional body as a membrane) Khhhhhhhhooooooco00! Ruben increases the tempo and brings the show to an audit climax.  11.

dialogues.speaker: STATES
dialogues.text: A taxi arrives at the Cold War Bar. KRIS BARUTANSKI (45) leaves the cab and walks towards the entrance. The door m MORTIMER(58) greets him.

dialogues.speaker: MORTIMER
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Barutanski!

dialogues.speaker: KRIS BARUTANSKI
dialogues.text: Hi, Mortimer! The door opens and Kris Barutanski walks in, heading stra for the bar counter. He sits down next to his old acquaintance, JOHN COOPER (7 a retired CIA agent, who is watching the news. Right next him, a WAITER (30) is collecting glasses, standing next t the busy bar.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Four Kalashnikovs! BREAKING NEWS II. «+. But Mike Kowalski, a private detective from Washington DC, managed to save the priceless fan by leaping into the River Seine, where the thief had thrown it. At the news conference, the Managing Director of the Louvre Museum, admitted that the incident revealed lapses in the security system.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN COOPER
dialogues.text: I know that guy! Kowalski... Huh...

dialogues.speaker: KRIS BARUTANSKI
dialogues.text: Is he one of yours?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN COOPER
dialogues.text: Nah, his father, Gerhard, used to work for the Company. We worked on Subliminal Programming together, which focused on experiments with 16 mm film. That was one hell of a project. Good old fashioned rivalry with the Russians...

dialogues.speaker: UNITED STATES
dialogues.text: HOCKEY (a hamster) merrily jogs around his wheel. The whe is linked by cogs and belts to a zoetrope, so that Hockey enjoy the screening of a film.  12. Kowalski watches the TV, muted. The TV shows scenes from action TV-series Larissa. At one point, Larissa performs acrobatic leap from a bridge onto a moving truck. He take sip from his whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a second! (Kowalski rewinds the footage) I knew it! That’s exactly the same forward jump with a backward somersault. (turns to Hockey) Hockey, I ran across an interesting girl. I have to get to know her. He grabs his laptop from the desk and looks up movie information on the internet. MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) No way, can't be her... But there’s got to be... Bingo! Stunt double, Mimi. So, your name is Mimi. Are you a member of the Stuntmen's Association? (he types on the keyboard, then turns to Hockey) It's no good, Hockey. Mimi isn’t a joiner. The telephone rings. Kowalski gets up to answer it. He fi an oblique photo on the wall on his way. Next to the photo, a collection of knives from famous mov can be seen: First Blood, Knife in the Water etc. He answers the call. It's his mother, EVA KOWALSKI (70). MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: EVA KOWALSKI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The same shirt again!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: EVA KOWALSKI, (V.O)
dialogues.text: Is it my fault? Did I raise you this way? International broadcast, same shirt as in November!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: You have the memory of an elephant.

dialogues.speaker: EVA KOWALSKI, (V.O)
dialogues.text: Don't humor me, young man!  13.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Hey mom, you want humor? Father's day is coming up. Care to tell me something? A mosquito starts buzzing around his head.

dialogues.speaker: EVA KOWALSKI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No. What are you getting at?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: My father's identity?

dialogues.speaker: EVA KOWALSKI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Not again! We have already discussed this, I don't want to go...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: We haven't discussed anything, you just keep silent! Who was he, Rasputin?

dialogues.speaker: EVA KOWALSKI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No. It’s not funny!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: One suspect is out. 4 billion remain.

dialogues.speaker: EVA KOWALSKI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mike, this issue is closed as far as I'm concerned. Sorry for pestering you, but... Kowalski stares at the data on the laptop screen. The mosquito is still buzzing around his head.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: That’s okay, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: EVA KOWALSKI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Alright son. I will talk to you tomorrow. Take care!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Will do, mom. MIKE KOWALSKI (CONT’D) Eva Kowalski hangs up. Kowalski brushes aside the mosquit It lands on a glass pane above a collection of famous straight razors from movies. Kowalski swiftly, but delicately hits the mosquito. Only ice cube in his whiskey (shaped like Hitchcock's body) sh a little bit.  14.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was his fault, Hockey. He drew first blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruben Brandt shows Mimi around the Polyart Clinic. They a walking outside in the garden, when they stop by Bye-Bye who is in the position of Rodin’s “The Thinker.” He doesn move, he looks like a statue.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Not a very good forgery. Bye-Bye Joe doesn’t stay in his position.

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: Hey - I'm not a forgery!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (flirting) What are you then, darling?

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Different covers of magazines appear on the screen. All articles deal with Bye-Bye Joe, who, as a security guard, cannot keep his mouth shut. “Celebrity bodyguard Bye-Bye Joe apologizes over speech scandal!” “Celebrity bodyguard Bye-Bye Joe scandal monologue at Chi Fashion Couture Week” “BBJ: I need to shut up now!”

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: (flirting) I’m the real thing, baby. Ruben Brandt steps in the middle of the situation.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: (scolding) Bye-Bye Joe!

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: I know, I know... Statues don't speak.  15. Bye-Bye Joe is back to the original position of The Think

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Impressive, doctor. Ruben doesn’t get the sarcastic tone. Membrano Bruno carv sculpture, Fernando plays a strange Indian instrument.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Art is the key to the troubles of the mind. RUBEN BRANDT (CONT’D) Membrano Bruno is two-dimensional, but he eats too much, which is getting in the way of his banking business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Membrano Bruno tries to slip under a door, but he is too to fit.

dialogues.speaker: MEMBRANO BRUNO
dialogues.text: Too many sausages!

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK ENDS
dialogues.text: EXT. - THE POLYART CLINIC. DORNBERK. SLOVENIA —- MORNING

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Too many sausages... RUBEN BRANDT (CONT’D) He’s trying to carve his craving for food into stone to contain it.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: “Possess your problems to conquer them.”

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: (surprised) Hm, exactly!

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: I read it in a magazine. Fernando walks towards Mimi and Ruben. He obsessively pla three-note melody.  16.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Fernando is dealing with his particular obsession by creating variations on a three-note melody.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: What’s his obsession?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: The signature he leaves after each successful security breach.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK TO
dialogues.text: EXT. — PARK - NIGHT Fernando sits on a bench with a girl while he is typing o laptop. The electricity suddenly shuts down in a neighborhood, and three eyes appear on the facade of a ba The siren of an approaching police car gets stronger and stronger. Fernando shuts his laptop down in panic.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: So, what about me, Doc? (imitates with her hand) Ventriloquism? Ruben shows Mimi to an easel with a blank canvas.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Your compulsion to steal comes from a deeper need. You are missing something in your life. (beat) I want you to paint it.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: How can I paint it if I don't know what it is?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Trust in the brush. It will reveal all.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: If you say so...  17. 0110. INT. - RUBEN BRANDT’S CABINET. THE POLYART CLINIC. DORNBERK. SLOVENIA —- DAY Ruben enters his cabinet with the mail and an Art Magazin his hands. He puts the magazine on the desk next to his v recorder, while he reads a letter. Suddenly, he hears a female voice from his desk. It’s EDOUARD MANET’S OLYMPIA (30).

dialogues.speaker: OLYMPIA
dialogues.text: Come closer, Ruben! OLYMPIA (CONT’D) Come closer! Ruben slowly approaches the magazine. Olympia’s face sudd jumps out from the cover of the Art Magazine. OLYMPIA (CONT’D) If I frightened you forgive me! And come to Paris to see me sometime. Ruben Brandt tries to pick up the voice recorder but he i too shocked. He throws the recorder to the floor and leav the cabinet. Meanwhile, Mimi stands behind the wall of the terrace and watches the whole scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wheels of an airplane land on a runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruben Brandt enters the hall where the paintings of Edoua Manet are exhibited. Ruben slowly approaches Olympia. She looks him straight in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: OLYMPIA
dialogues.text: I’ve been waiting for you, Ruben! Olympia screams and suddenly swings her left leg, and her high-heeled slipper flies off. The heel of the shoe stick into Ruben's chest like a knife. The cat leaps at his fac sinking its claws into it. Ruben screams as he tries to remove the cat from his face. He falls on the floor and l consciousness.  18.

dialogues.speaker: VIPAVA VALLEY. SLOVENIA
dialogues.text: Ruben is on a therapy session at PROFESSOR WALDEN’s (60) room. He watches the lake from the inside, lying on a recliner. His face is full of scratches, his arm is cover with purple and blue marks and bruises.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR WALDEN
dialogues.text: Ruben, you said that everything started after your father's funeral, a month ago. Ruben closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruben stands next to his father’s coffin with a PRIEST (5 and his father’s close relatives and friends. John Cooper among them too.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: ... Body to the ground... Earth to earth... Ashes to ashes and dust to dust... 0145. EXT./INT, - GERHARD BRANDT’S HOUSE. WASHINGTON DC. DAY -— CONTINUOUS Ruben leaves his car in front of his father’s house and w inside.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I went back to his house. I hadn't been to his lab in years. All my childhood memories suddenly hit me. When Ruben enters the film lab, he sees himself as a chil sitting by a film projector. YOUNG RUBEN (5) is with his father, GERHARD BRANDT (40).

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RUBEN
dialogues.text: Daddy, can I go outside and play with the snails?

dialogues.speaker: GERHARD BRANDT
dialogues.text: No, Ruben. Maybe later. This time is our cartoon time.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RUBEN
dialogues.text: (sobbing) But Daddy, please!  19.

dialogues.speaker: GERHARD BRANDT
dialogues.text: Ruben, men don't cry! The past disappears. Ruben Brandt approaches the projecto and hits play.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: It was Rusalocka. My favorite cartoon.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR WALDEN
dialogues.text: Ah, the Little Mermaid.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: But for some reason I couldn’t watch it. I felt anxious and I had to escape.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR WALDEN
dialogues.text: Remember the Sea Witch? Do you think she has any connection to your next visit, to Botticelli’s Venus?

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: I don’t want to talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR WALDEN
dialogues.text: (angry) Ruben, look at me! If you don’t let me help you, you’re going to kill yourself! Or someone else...

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT, (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogues.text: -.. and I bet Doc’s voice recorder belonged to Sigmund Freud! The guys laugh, Mimi just smiles.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Get serious, guys! Don't you want to help him?

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: But what can we do about it?

dialogues.speaker: MEMBRANO BRUNO
dialogues.text: I feel like you already have a plan.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Yes. As a matter of fact, I do. And it involves all of you.

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: But there’s only one thing that we're any good at.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Exactly!

dialogues.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogues.text: Doc is a tipo simpatico. But what's in it for us?

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Don't you want to know if your therapy is working?

dialogues.speaker: MEMBRANO BRUNO
dialogues.text: Let’s check it out! They clink their glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mimi, Fernando, Bye-Bye Joe and Membrano Bruno are on a b on the river Seine in Paris.

dialogues.speaker: FERNANDO
dialogues.text: Guys... Cameras and alarm system are prepped.  21.

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: (high fiving each other) Great stuff, Fernando, I’m impressed! Bye-Bye Joe shakes a bronze spray bottle.

dialogues.speaker: MIMI
dialogues.text: Don’t forget, Joe! Statues don’t speak.

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: (murmuring) Yeah, yeah... I got it. Statues don’t speak, thanks...

dialogues.text: Bye-Bye Joe and Membrano Bruno stand in front of Musée d'Orsay. They move towards entrance "A."

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: And your mother is... normal?

dialogues.speaker: MEMBRANO BRUNO
dialogues.text: What do you mean normal?

dialogues.speaker: BYE-BYE JOE
dialogues.text: Well, I-I mean, is she three- dimensional? Bye-Bye Joe and Membrano Bruno approach the counter.

dialogues.speaker: MEMBRANO BRUNO
dialogues.text: Yeah, she is three-dimensional. (to the cashier, forming a “v" with his fingers) Deux billets, s'il vous plait. (Two tickets, please.) The CASHIER (45) lifts her hand and forms a “V" with her fingers as well.

dialogues.speaker: CASHIER
dialogues.text: Deux? (Two? )

dialogues.speaker: MEMBRANO BRUNO
dialogues.text: (again making a “V") Deux. (Two. )

dialogues.text: Oui, Monsieur. (Okay, Sir.)  22.

dialogues.text: Your French is really good. Is your mother French? Membrano Bruno looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: RUBEN BRANDT
dialogues.text: Van Gogh’s Postman and Warhol’s Double Elvis.

dialogues.text: The president of the cartel, GARRET GRAHAM (70), is sitti at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: If we don’t crack this case soon, we'll never see those paintings again.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET GRAHAM
dialogues.text: Is this why we’re paying you so much?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: With all due respect, Mr. Graham, we are dealing with a collector here and not a serial thief. He is taking paintings which couldn’t be sold. Not even on the black market.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET GRAHAM
dialogues.text: Mr. Kowalski, I’ve been in this business for 45 years and I can tell you that in 6 months someone will put Olympia up for sale in South Blitvia.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: No. Someone is building a collection. As a collector myself, I understand how they think. Once the collection is complete, he or she will stop.

dialogues.speaker: GARRET GRAHAM
dialogues.text: You follow your instincts and we will follow our experience. We are raising the reward to a 100 million dollars!

dialogues.text: Boris cannot believe his ears.  38.

dialogues.speaker: BORIS
dialogues.text: Chort poberi, a 100 million! I must call Vincenzo!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Ciao Marina, did you hear?

dialogues.speaker: VINCENZO DELANGELLO
dialogues.text: (as he sweeps things from his desk) Damn! What do we pay Boris for? The lieutenant rolls out the painting which contains a po of a cat and a mouse. Suddenly, everyone bursts out laugh Vincenzo is relieved. Stupid police.

dialogues.text: Ha-ha-ha!

dialogues.speaker: NEWS CORRESPONDENT
dialogues.text: What an epic failure for the Roman Police Department! Suddenly, Giuseppe recognizes the woman on the news.

dialogues.text: B-b-b-boss, look!

dialogues.speaker: VICENZO DELANGELLO
dialogues.text: Porca puttana! That’s Mimi! Mimi poses with the poster for the press.  4l.

dialogues.text: John Cooper enters the Cold War Bar and he heads for his usual table. Kris Barutanski is already there. Boris is sitting at a table nearby.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS BARUTANSKI
dialogues.text: Long time no see, Cooper!

dialogues.speaker: JOHN COOPER
dialogues.text: I needed some solitude. Took my yearly trip to the mountains. Sometimes, I wonder why I come back at all.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS BARUTANSKI

dialogues.speaker: JOHN COOPER
dialogues.text: (to himself) Aha! He dials a number. Meanwhile, Barutanski passes by a waitress and takes two drinks from her without even asking.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS BARUTANSKI
dialogues.text: (ironically) Keep the change, darling!

dialogues.text: (ironically) Oh! Thanks, Kris! Generous, as always! Barutanski laughs. When he gets back, Cooper is already o the phone. Cooper doesn't notice, but Barutanski is behind him, eavesdropping on the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN COOPER
dialogues.text: (keeping his voice low) I know who the Collector is. I will tell you the details in person.

dialogues.text: Hey, Mike!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Ciao Marina! Could you look up a name for me please? John Cooper, 124 Penn Street, South East. Washington DC.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS BARUTANSKI
dialogues.text: (holds two drinks) Wait, Cooper. What about our drink?

dialogues.text: Gotta hurry.

dialogues.text: Yeah, I overheard you! Come on! Won't you help out an old friend?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN COOPER
dialogues.text: Acquaintance.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS BARUTANSKI
dialogues.text: Look, you don’t want to do this alone, huh? We’1ll split the money. Fifty-fifty. Just tell me who the Collector is!

dialogues.text: That's... It's not his fault. I'd never betray my friends.

dialogues.speaker: KRIS BARUTANSKI
dialogues.text: Friends?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN COOPER
dialogues.text: Now, if you’1l excuse me. Cooper gets up and leaves Barutanski.

dialogues.text: INT. MARINA’S APARTMENT. ROME. ITALY - MORNING Marina is reading a book by an ancient Roman swimming poo when her phone rings. She answers.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Hey, Mike!

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Ciao, Marina! Can you look up another name for me, please -— Gerhard Brandt, B- R-A-N-D- T, former CIA Agent?  45.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Just a second, Mike. (she types on the keyboard) Hello, you there?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Of course!

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Okay, Gerhard Brandt, born in Berlin 1938, grew up in East Berlin. Former Stasi colonel, expert in psychotechnics.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Psychotechnics?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Practical applications of psychology.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Like political propaganda?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Smart boy. With help from the CIA, in 1967 he moved with his wife Helga and two-year old son Ruben to Washington D.C.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: What did he do for the CIA?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Experiments with subliminal perception for the Special Activities Division, where John Cooper worked too. His wife died in a car accident in 1975. And... here, an obituary: he died of a heart attack one month ago.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Last known address?

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: 842 Bladensburg Road.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Thanks. Call the cops to Cooper's house.

dialogues.speaker: MARINA
dialogues.text: Okay. What’s the crime?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Murder.  46. Kowalski leaves the room. Barutanski climbs down from a cupboard above the door.

dialogues.text: Huh? KRIS BARUTANSKI (CONT’D) Ah, so you wanna play... Boris tries to catch up with him, but after a sharp turn crashes into a pylon. dialogues.text: Mike! Mike! MARINA’S LOVER (In Italian) Scusa Marina, ma cosa sta succedendo? (Excuse me, Marina! What is going on?)

But what he finds behind leaves him speechless: the photo sees on the shelf is the same one that he has in his apartment, with his mother holding him. Only that this is bigger picture - on the right side of the photo, we can s Gerhard Brandt with a young boy.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE KOWALSKI
dialogues.text: Oh, my goodness! He pulls out his cell phone and dials.

dialogues.text: Hey, Mikey! I just bought you a new shirt! EVA KOWALSKI (CONT’D) Mike?

dialogues.text: Mom? What does the name Gerhard Brandt mean to you? (beat) Mom, I asked you a question! (beat) What does the name Gerhard Brandt mean to you?

dialogues.text: Bloody hell! Jesus! Oh my God!
